definition: definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
lump (of earth)/chunk/piece/classifier for pieces of cloth, cake, soap etc/(coll.) classifier for money and currency units

sentences.english: It has advantages of high speed, good-shaped and no scrap.
sentences.chinese: 切块速度快，铅块成型好，无飞边。

sentences.english: Cut all the bell peppers into pieces.
Skin carrot and cut in to pieces. Skin shallots.
sentences.chinese: 红萝卜去皮切块，红葱头去皮保持原粒。

sentences.english: But peeling and chopping carrots, for example, can sap nutrients.
sentences.chinese: 然而，例如剥皮和切块的胡萝卜会损失营养。

sentences.english: Clean and cut corn into pieces. Clean and wash other ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 粟米洗净切块，其馀材料洗净整理好备用。

sentences.english: This makes slicing and dicing your bytecode easy.
sentences.chinese: 这使对字节码的切片和切块变得容易。

sentences.english: In the Middle Ages people used to carve amicable numbers into pieces of fruit.
sentences.chinese: 在中世纪，人们会把一组亲和数刻在水果切块上。

sentences.english: Peel and dice a cucumber, reserving eight to 10 slices for garnish.
sentences.chinese: 削去一颗黄瓜的皮，切块，保留8至10片做装饰。

sentences.english: In another dish, deep-fried bits of dried beef were cooked, in a touch of fusion, with pine nuts.
sentences.chinese: 风干牛肉切块炸过之后与松子很好地配成了一道菜。

sentences.english: First, peel and cube the potatoes.
Marinated cubes of lamb threaded on a skewer.
Wash the Oxtail, cut into pieces then season.
sentences.chinese: 将牛尾洗净，切块后加入腌料拌匀。

definition: to peel/to remove the skin/to tare
chunks obtained by repeatedly cutting a vegetable diagonally and rotating the vegetable after each cut
to slice/slice/thin section of a specimen (for microscopic examination)
to cut up (into pieces)/to slice/to carve/to dice/to shred
pork chop/pork cutlet/spare ribs/(coll.) skinny person
quick-boil/to boil for a short time
